name: Spaghetti Carbonara
details: An Italian pasta dish from Rome.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
Meanwhile, cut guanciale or pancetta into small pieces. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook guanciale until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, salt, and pepper.
Drain cooked spaghetti, reserving some pasta water. Immediately add hot spaghetti to the skillet with guanciale, tossing to coat.
Remove skillet from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with additional Pecorino Romano cheese and black pepper.

name: Chicken Curry
details: A spicy and flavorful dish.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium-high heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, sauté for another minute until fragrant.
Add chicken cubes to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in curry powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes until spices are fragrant.
Pour in coconut milk, chicken broth, soy sauce, and tomato paste. Stir to combine.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and let it simmer uncovered for 20-25 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce is thickened.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, alongside rice or naan.

name: Chole
details: A spicy and tangy chickpea curry.
instructions: Cook chickpeas in a pressure cooker until soft.
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. When they start to splutter, add onions, garlic, and ginger; sauté until golden.
Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Biryani
details: A flavorful rice dish made with basmati rice, meat, and aromatic spices.
ingredients: 500g chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
Fresh cilantro and mint for garnish
instructions: Cook rice until 70% done and set aside.
Heat ghee or oil in a large pot and fry onions until golden and crispy. Remove half and set aside for garnish.
Add garlic, ginger, and tomatoes to the pot; sauté until tomatoes are soft.
Add meat, yogurt, biryani masala, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until meat is tender.
Layer half of the cooked rice over the meat mixture. Sprinkle with fried onions, cilantro, and mint.
Layer remaining rice on top. Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

name: Samosa
details: A popular Indian snack filled with spiced potatoes and peas.
instructions: Mix flour, salt, and oil in a bowl. Add water gradually and knead into a firm dough. Set aside.
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. When they start to splutter, add onions and green chilies; sauté until onions are soft.
Add mashed potatoes, peas, garam masala, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Roll out dough and cut into circles. Fill each circle with the potato mixture and fold into a triangle.
Heat oil in a deep fryer and fry samosas until golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney.

name: Dosa
details: A crispy South Indian crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter.
instructions: Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds in water for 6 hours. Grind into a smooth batter and ferment overnight.
Add salt to the fermented batter and mix well.
Heat a non-stick pan and pour a ladleful of batter, spreading it into a thin circle.
Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until golden brown.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Paneer Tikka
details: Grilled paneer cubes marinated in spices and yogurt.
instructions: Mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, cumin powder, and salt in a bowl.
Add paneer cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Thread marinated paneer onto skewers and grill on medium heat until golden brown.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and mint chutney.

name: Rogan Josh
details: A flavorful lamb curry from Kashmir.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot and add cumin seeds. When they start to splutter, add onions, garlic, and ginger; sauté until golden.
Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add lamb pieces and cook until browned.
Stir in yogurt and simmer until lamb is tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Aloo Gobi
details: A vegetarian curry made with potatoes and cauliflower.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. When they start to splutter, add onions, garlic, and ginger; sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, garam masala, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add potatoes and cauliflower, stirring to coat with spices.
Cover and cook until vegetables are tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Gulab Jamun
details: A popular Indian dessert made of deep-fried dough balls soaked in sugar syrup.
instructions: Mix milk powder, flour, and baking soda in a bowl. Add ghee and mix well.
Gradually add milk and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for 10 minutes.
Divide dough into small balls.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry dough balls until golden brown.
In a separate pan, dissolve sugar in water and bring to a boil. Add cardamom powder and simmer for 10 minutes.
Soak fried dough balls in hot sugar syrup for at least 30 minutes.
Serve warm or chilled.

name: Rasgulla
details: Soft and spongy cheese balls soaked in sugar syrup.
instructions: Boil milk in a pan. Add lemon juice to curdle the milk.
Strain the curdled milk using a muslin cloth to separate the chenna (paneer). Rinse under cold water and squeeze out excess water.
Knead the chenna until smooth and soft. Make small balls from the chenna.
In a large pot, dissolve sugar in water and bring to a boil.
Add chenna balls to the boiling syrup and cook for 15 minutes, covered.
Add rose water and let the rasgullas cool in the syrup.
Serve chilled.

name: Jalebi
details: Crispy and sweet pretzel-like dessert soaked in sugar syrup.
instructions: Mix flour, cornflour, yogurt, baking powder, and turmeric powder in a bowl. Add water to make a smooth batter and let it ferment for 8 hours.
Heat oil in a pan. Pour the batter into a piping bag and pipe spirals into the hot oil. Fry until golden and crispy.
In a separate pan, dissolve sugar in water and bring to a boil. Add cardamom powder and saffron strands.
Soak the fried jalebis in the hot sugar syrup for a few minutes.
Serve hot.

name: Kheer
details: A creamy rice pudding flavored with cardamom and saffron.
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes.
Boil milk in a large pot. Add soaked rice and cook on low heat until the rice is soft and the milk has thickened.
Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands. Cook for another 10 minutes.
Garnish with chopped nuts.
Serve warm or chilled.

name: Ladoo
details: Sweet round balls made from gram flour, ghee, and sugar.
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan and add gram flour. Roast on low heat until golden brown and fragrant.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. Add powdered sugar and cardamom powder; mix well.
Form the mixture into small balls (ladoo).
Garnish with chopped nuts if desired.
Store in an airtight container.

name: Barfi
details: A dense and sweet milk-based confection.
instructions: Mix milk powder and heavy cream in a pan. Cook on low heat until the mixture thickens.
Add sugar and cardamom powder. Continue to cook until the mixture leaves the sides of the pan.
Pour the mixture into a greased tray and smooth the top.
Garnish with chopped nuts and let it cool.
Cut into squares and serve.

name: Rasmalai
details: Soft paneer discs soaked in sweetened milk flavored with cardamom and saffron.
instructions: Boil milk in a pan. Add lemon juice to curdle the milk.
Strain the curdled milk using a muslin cloth to separate the chenna (paneer). Rinse under cold water and squeeze out excess water.
Knead the chenna until smooth and soft. Make small discs from the chenna.
In a large pot, dissolve sugar in water and bring to a boil.
Add chenna discs to the boiling syrup and cook for 15 minutes, covered.
Boil milk for rabri in a separate pan until it reduces to half. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands.
Soak the chenna discs in rabri and garnish with chopped nuts.
Serve chilled.

name: Chocolate Cake
details: A rich and moist chocolate cake perfect for any occasion.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Stir in boiling water (batter will be thin).
Pour batter into prepared pans and bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Vanilla Cake
details: A classic vanilla cake that is light, fluffy, and perfect for layering.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add the flour mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Beat until just combined.
Stir in vanilla extract.
Pour batter into prepared pans and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Red Velvet Cake
details: A striking red cake with a hint of cocoa, traditionally layered with cream cheese frosting.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.
In a medium bowl, sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, and cocoa powder.
In a large bowl, gently beat together the oil, buttermilk, eggs, food coloring, vanilla, and vinegar.
Add the sifted dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until smooth and combined.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes, then remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Chocolate Milkshake
details: A rich and creamy chocolate milkshake made with chocolate ice cream and milk.
instructions: In a blender, combine chocolate ice cream, milk, and chocolate syrup.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream and chocolate shavings if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Strawberry Milkshake
details: A refreshing strawberry milkshake made with fresh strawberries and vanilla ice cream.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
instructions: In a blender, combine strawberries, vanilla ice cream, and milk.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream and strawberry slices if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Vanilla Milkshake
details: A classic vanilla milkshake made with vanilla ice cream and milk.
instructions: In a blender, combine vanilla ice cream, milk, and vanilla extract.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream and sprinkles if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Banana Milkshake
details: A creamy banana milkshake made with ripe bananas and vanilla ice cream.
instructions: In a blender, combine bananas, vanilla ice cream, milk, and vanilla extract.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream and banana slices if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Vanilla Ice Cream
details: A classic and creamy vanilla ice cream made with simple ingredients.
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together the cream, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt until the sugar is dissolved.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Transfer the churned ice cream to a lidded container and freeze for at least 4 hours or until firm.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Chocolate Ice Cream
details: A rich and creamy chocolate ice cream made with cocoa powder and chocolate chips.
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the cream, milk, sugar, and cocoa powder. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly until the sugar and cocoa powder are dissolved.
Remove from heat and stir in the chocolate chips until melted and smooth.
Stir in the vanilla extract and salt.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Transfer the churned ice cream to a lidded container and freeze for at least 4 hours or until firm.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Chocolate Ice Cream
details: A rich and creamy chocolate ice cream made with cocoa powder and chocolate chips.
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the cream, milk, sugar, and cocoa powder. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly until the sugar and cocoa powder are dissolved.
Remove from heat and stir in the chocolate chips until melted and smooth.
Stir in the vanilla extract and salt.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Transfer the churned ice cream to a lidded container and freeze for at least 4 hours or until firm.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Tiramisu
details: A popular Italian dessert made with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers, mascarpone cheese, and cocoa powder.
instructions: In a medium saucepan, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until well blended. Whisk in milk and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture boils. Boil gently for 1 minute, then remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Cover tightly and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
In a medium bowl, beat cream with vanilla extract until stiff peaks form.
Whisk mascarpone into yolk mixture until smooth.
In a small bowl, combine coffee and coffee liqueur (if using).
Dip each ladyfinger into coffee mixture for about 1 second and place in the bottom of a 9x13 inch dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers, then half of the whipped cream.
Repeat layers and sprinkle with cocoa powder.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

name: Baklava
details: A rich, sweet pastry made of layers of filo filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup or honey.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Toss nuts with cinnamon and set aside.
Unroll phyllo dough and cut whole stack in half to fit the dish.
Cover phyllo with a damp cloth while assembling the baklava to keep it from drying out.
Place two sheets of phyllo in the dish, butter thoroughly. Repeat until you have 8 sheets layered.
Sprinkle 2-3 tablespoons of nut mixture on top. Top with two sheets of phyllo, butter, nuts, layering as you go.
The top layer should be about 6-8 sheets deep.
Using a sharp knife, cut into diamond or square shapes all the way to the bottom of the dish.
Bake for about 50 minutes until baklava is golden and crisp.
Make sauce while baklava is baking: Boil sugar and water until sugar is melted. Add vanilla and honey. Simmer for about 20 minutes.
Remove baklava from oven and immediately spoon sauce over it.
Let cool completely before serving.

name: Mochi
details: A traditional Japanese rice cake made with glutinous rice flour, often filled with sweet red bean paste.
instructions: In a microwave-safe bowl, mix glutinous rice flour and sugar.
Gradually add water and stir until smooth.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and microwave for 2 minutes.
Stir the mixture, re-cover, and microwave for another 1-2 minutes until the dough is translucent.
Dust a surface with cornstarch and turn the dough onto it. Let cool slightly.
Divide the dough into 8 equal pieces and flatten each piece into a circle.
Place a small amount of red bean paste in the center of each circle and pinch the edges together to seal.
Roll the mochi in cornstarch to prevent sticking.
Serve immediately or store in an airtight container.

name: Spinach and Artichoke Dip
details: A creamy and cheesy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a blend of cheeses, perfect for serving with bread or crackers.
ingredients: 1 can (14 oz) artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
1 package (10 oz) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, artichokes, spinach, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the dip is hot and bubbly.
Serve with bread or crackers.

name: Caprese Skewers
details: A simple and fresh appetizer made with cherry tomatoes, mozzarella balls, and basil leaves.
instructions: Thread one cherry tomato, one basil leaf, and one mozzarella ball onto each skewer.
Arrange skewers on a serving platter.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

name: Stuffed Mushrooms
details: Savory mushrooms filled with a delicious mixture of cream cheese, garlic, and herbs.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Clean mushrooms with a damp paper towel. Remove stems and finely chop them.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Cook onion, garlic, and chopped mushroom stems until tender.
In a bowl, combine cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, parsley, salt, and pepper. Add the cooked onion mixture and stir until well blended.
Spoon the cream cheese mixture into the mushroom caps and place them on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and filling is golden brown.
Serve warm.

name: Bruschetta
details: A classic Italian appetizer featuring toasted bread topped with fresh tomatoes, basil, garlic, and olive oil.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
Arrange baguette slices on a baking sheet and brush with olive oil.
Toast in the oven for 5-7 minutes or until golden brown.
In a bowl, combine tomatoes, basil, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Top each toasted baguette slice with the tomato mixture.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Classic Mojito
details: A refreshing Cuban cocktail made with rum, fresh mint, lime juice, sugar, and soda water.
ingredients: 10 fresh mint leaves, plus extra sprigs for garnish
2 tbsp white sugar, or to taste
instructions: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass. Use a muddler to crush the mint and lime to release the mint oils and lime juice.
Add 2 more lime wedges and sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice.
Do not strain the mixture. Fill the glass almost to the top with ice.
Pour the rum over the ice, and fill the glass with soda water. Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired.
Garnish with the remaining lime wedge and mint sprig.
